Learn to use JavaScript & the HTML5 canvas tag for games, art, infographics, & other creative coding.

Get awesome at using the canvas tag & JavaScript for creative coding.

Learning to make games, weird internet art, or interactive infographics?
Learn to use the HTML5 canvas tag in your projects.

The canvas is the simplest way to get started making weird, fun projects using JavaScript. Learn it. Experiment. Level up.

About the book

Chapter list:

  1. Getting set up
  2. Drawing "hello" with lines
  3. Writing on a canvas with text
  4. Creating an animation loop
  5. Drawing on a canvas with a mouse
  6. Keyboard input
  7. Drawing images on a canvas
  8. Drawing video on a canvas
  9. Save an animated gif from a canvas element
  10. Make a simple game
  11. Make weird art
  12. Creating interactive infographics
  13. Cheatsheet: canvas methods and properties

Canvassing is an introductory guide to the HTML5 canvas tag, a resource for learning to make games, weird internet art, interactive infographics, and other creative coding using the canvas.



You'll learn these topics:

  • Drawing paths, shapes, etc., and working with color
  • Drawing images/spritesheets on the canvas
  • How to create a game/animation loop
  • Detecting mouse & keyboard input
  • Creating complex animation sequences
  • Using the canvas tag in tandem with manipulating other html elements
  • Making animated gifs from a canvas animation
  • Using video on the canvas
  • An overview of awesome libraries you can use with the canvas tag
  • Usage of methods and properties of the canvas tag
  • Using JavaScript modules from npm for browser-side code
  • Introduce you to modern development tools & practices

About the author

Seth Vincent writes code, stories, and music. He's an independent programmer, designer and writer focused on storytelling and javascript. About Learn.js

The Learn.js series teaches:

  • JavaScript syntax, functions, data types, and programming patterns.
  • How to find and use Javascript libraries.
  • Using JavaScript to manipulate html elements.
  • Using JavaScript for server-side coding.
  • Using developer tools like Git, GitHub, Chrome Dev Tools, Bower, npm, and Grunt.
  • How to build a wide range of projects with JavaScript, from the server to the client, from game development to data analysis.

Other Learn.js books include:

Introduction to JavaScript & Node.js

Making 2d Games with JavaScript

Mapping with Leaflet.js
